tool.name: bash
tool.description:
Execute a shell command in the system's default shell.
IMPORTANT: Always use 'workdir' parameter instead of 'cd' commands for changing directories. Commands will be executed with the shell's default behavior.
Output is automatically truncated at 500 lines or 30000 characters.

parameters.parameter: The command to execute. Can be multi-line.
Optional timeout in seconds. Defaults to 120 seconds.
The working directory to run the command in. Use this instead of 'cd' commands.
Clear, concise description of what this command does in 5-10 words. Examples: - "Lists files in current directory" - "Shows working tree status" - "Installs package dependencies"
